com.xhive.index.interfaces
Interface XhiveCCIndexIf

All Superinterfaces:
XhiveIndexIf, XhiveLockingContextIf, XhiveNamedItemIf
public interface XhiveCCIndexIf
extends XhiveIndexIf

A Context Conditioned index is created by using the addNodeFilterIndex factory method on the XhiveIndexListIf.

This index type is not live in that sense that it will not update automatically when the documents that it indexes are changed. Indexes have to be updated explicitly by (re)using the indexDocument or removeDocument method.

The index maintains references to nodes in the database. The user has the responsibility to update the index after data modifications by using:

  • function indexDocument in case of addition of new document or a modification within a document.
  • function removeDocument in case of document removal.

WARNING: The index update must be executed before the data update is committed. When data with entries in the CC-index is removed from the database and the transaction is committed before the index is updated, the index may become corrupt. In case of adding of documents, this problem will not occur.

Only live indexes are used by XQuery/XPath/XPointer queries

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
more info about index types, their live behaviour and internal usage.

Method Detail

getNodeFilterClassName

java.lang.String getNodeFilterClassName()
Get the name of the nodefilter that belongs to this index.

Returns:
the name of the nodefilter belonging to this index.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

indexDocument

boolean indexDocument(Document doc)
Apply the index to a document. Before reindexing the document it is checked if the document has changed, if not than the document won't be re-indexed.

During indexing, if a classloader was specified on the driver, it will be used to instantiate the node-filter class.

Parameters:
doc - the document that has to be indexed.
Returns:
true if the document is indexed (or re-indexed)
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
XhiveDriverIf.setUserClassLoader(ClassLoader)

indexDocument

boolean indexDocument(Document doc,
                      java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
Apply the index to a document. Before reindexing the document it is checked if the document has changed, if not than the document won't be re-indexed.

Parameters:
doc - the document that has to be indexed.
classLoader - the classloader to be used for instantiating the index node filter. In a servlet setting, you could use this variation of indexDocument to use an index node filter class that is located in the servlet directory (normal usage would be indexDocument(document, this.getClass().getClassLoader()).

Even though this method is explicitly made deprecated, we advise to set the classloader on the driver, and use the standard indexDocument instead.

Returns:
true if the document is indexed (or re-indexed)
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
XhiveDriverIf.setUserClassLoader(ClassLoader)

removeDocument

void removeDocument(Document doc)
Remove this index from a document.

Parameters:
doc - the document from which the index has to be removed.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
